name: Catia Trubiani
content: Catia Trubiani, Ph.D. in Computer Science Gran Sasso Science Institute (GSSI) viale Luigi Rendina, 26-28, 67100 LâAquila, Italy catia.trubiani@gssi.it "... if you don't know then guess it precisely..." quote from Fred Brooks at 3rd Heidelberg Laureate Forum Upcoming events: International Conference on Performance Engineering - ICPE 2026 International Conference on Software Analysis, Evolution and Reengineering - SANER 2026 International Symposium on Software Engineering for Adaptive and Self-Managing Systems - SEAMS 2026 International Conference on Software Architecture - ICSA 2026 Short bio I am Associate Professor in Computer Science at the Gran Sasso Science Institute (GSSI), L’Aquila (AQ), Italy. Before joining the GSSI, I have been with various international research institutes like the Karlsruhe Institute of Technology in Germany, and the Imperial College of London in UK. Among various projects, I am scientific coordinator for the MUR-PRIN project DREAM under the Young Line action. My main research interests include the quantitative modelling and analysis of interacting heterogeneous distributed systems. Some topics of interest include software performance, software reliability, software architectures, model-based software testing. Recent applications target federated learning systems, cyber-physical systems, and multi-agent systems. I hold the National scientific qualification as Full Professor in Italian Universities in Computer Science (01/B1) and Computer Engineering (09/H1).
